title.narrative: Turkey Energy Efficiency in Public Buildings

description.narrative: The objective of the Energy Efficiency in Public Buildings in Turkey is to reduce energy use in central government buildings and inform the development of sustainable financing mechanisms to support a scaled-up, national program for energy efficiency in public buildings. The first component will support the renovation of central government and central-government affiliated buildings (i.e., public buildings under central line ministries, such as schools and hospitals). The three subcomponents are: (1) Conventional EE investments in central government buildings; (2) Energy service company investments; and; (3) Pilot near-zero energy buildings. The second component will support various technical assistance activities, to be managed by both Ministry of Environment and Urbanization (MoEU) and Ministry of Energy and Natural Resources (MENR). The two subcomponents are: (1) Communication and outreach to solicit applications for future years, experts for energy audit and technical design reviews, and; (2) Build capacity for Energy service company (ESCO) market development through the training of ESCOs, provision of regulatory support, development of procedures, templates and case studies.

condition.narrative: Schedule 2, Section I.A.1 (a). The Borrower, through MoEU, shall be responsible for the overall implementation, management,coordination and oversight of the Project, including the Project's administrative, procurement, environmental and socialsafeguards, disbursement, financial management and monitoring and evaluation responsibilities, as specified in the ProjectOperations Manual (“POM”).

Schedule 2, Section I.A.1 (b). The Borrower, through MoEU, shall maintain, throughout Project implementation, a MoEU ProjectImplementing Unit (“MoEU-PIU”), with functions and responsibilities acceptable to the Bank, for the implementation of Part 1 andPart 2(a) of the Project.

Schedule 2, Section I.A.2. The Borrower, through MoENR, shall maintain, throughout Project implementation, a MoENR ProjectImplementing Unit (“MoENR-PIU”), with functions and responsibilities acceptable to the Bank, for the implementation of Part 2(b) ofthe Project.

Schedule 2, Section I.A.4. The Borrower, through MoEU and MoENR, shall maintain throughout Project implementation, and convene asnecessary, a Working Group to support the MoEU-PIU in the procurement, supervision, and approvals of Energy Audits for buildingrenovations and NZEB pilots, and of ESCO contracts.

Schedule 2, Section I.B.2. The Borrower, through MoEU, shall carry out the Project, and cause the Project to be carried out, inaccordance with the arrangements, procedures and guidelines set forth in the POM, provided, however, that in case of any conflictbetween the arrangements and procedures set out in the POM and the provisions of this Agreement, the provisions of this Agreementshall prevail.

Schedule 2, Section I.C.1 For the purposes of Part 1 of the Project, unless otherwise agreed to between the Bank and the Borrower,through MoEU: (a) the eligibility of Subproject proposals shall be determined on the basis of an appraisal carried out inaccordance with procedures acceptable to the Bank and detailed in the POM; and (b) a proposed Subproject shall be selected on thebasis of criteria set forth in the POM.

Schedule 2, Section I.C.3. To qualify for financing under Part 1 of the Project, prior to the start of each respective Subproject,the Borrower, through MoEU, shall issue to each Subproject beneficiary a project initiation letter, and obtain the signature of theauthorized representative of the respective Subproject beneficiary to the project initiation letter.

Schedule 2, Section I.D.1. The Borrower, through MoEU and MoENR, shall prepare and furnish to the Bank not later than January 1stof each year during the implementation of the Project, a proposed Annual Work Plan and Budget containing: (i) all activities to becarried out under the Project during the following year; (ii) a proposed financing plan for expenditures required for suchactivities, setting forth the proposed amounts and sources of financing; and (iii) any training activities that may be requiredunder the Project.

Schedule 2, Section I.D.2 (a), (b). For Part 1 (a) (i) and Part 1 (a) (ii) of the Project, the Borrower, through MoEU, shall:carry out and complete Energy Audits for the selected Subproject buildings to be renovated within the subsequent 12-month period;establish with reasonable accuracy the estimated costs for the proposed energy efficiency investments to be financed within thesaid 12-month period, all to the satisfaction of the Bank; and furnish to the Bank an investment plan for financing, setting forththe recommendations and results of the applicable Energy Audits.

Schedule 2, Section I.D.2 (c), (d). The Borrower, through MoEU, shall withdraw for eligible expenditures incurred for Part 1 (a)(i) and Part 1 (a) (ii) of the Project, in accordance with the allocations determined by the Bank and communicated to the Borrower,unless otherwise agreed to by the Bank.

Schedule 2, Section I.E.1. The Borrower, through MoEU, shall carry out the Project, and cause the Project to be carried out, as thecase may be, in accordance with the provisions and recommendations of the Environmental and Social Management Framework (ESMF), andto this end, shall maintain throughout Project implementation, dedicated teams to ensure the Project's compliance with the ESMF andthe subsequently prepared Environmental and Social Management Plans (ESMPs), acceptable to the Bank.

Schedule 2, Section I.E.7. The Borrower, through MoEU, shall, throughout Project implementation, maintain and publicize theavailability of a Project feedback and grievance redress mechanism, as set forth in the ESMF, in form and substance satisfactory tothe Bank.

title.narrative: Generation capacity of energy constructed or rehabilitated
Renewable energy generation capacity (other than hydropower) constructed under the project
Number of beneficiaries in renovated buildings
Percentage of women in energy audit and design/construction supervision firms contracted under Project who are key staff
Completion of policy analyses and development of recommendations to support the transition to sustainable financing in public buildings

baseline.value: No analysis of policy and regulatory barriers for national program

actual.value: No analysis of policy and regulatory barriers for national program

title.narrative: Design and submission for approval of sustainable financing mechanisms to support a national program for energy efficiency in public buildings

baseline.value: No sustainable financing mechanisms in place

target.value: Sustainable financing mechanisms endorsed by MENR submitted to the Government for approval.

actual.value: No sustainable financing mechanisms in place

title.narrative: Projected lifetime emissions reductions as a result of the energy savings
Number of females that participate in technical trainings organized by the PIU on energy audits, technical designs, and construction supervision
Development of a national program for energy efficiency in public buildings with sustainable financing and institutional mechanisms

baseline.value: No national program or plans in place

target.value: National program plan submitted for adoption

actual.value: No national program or plans in place
